Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: chris i
Reviews.Content: Nothing but the best experience. We arrived earlier than our check in time. They said it was not problem. The staff offered us cappicinos and snacks while we waited, even offered to hold our luggage in a locked room for us if we wanted to go around Rome. The room was ready for us in 30 minutes. In that 30 mintures the man at the front desk gave us a map of Rome- we told him the sights we wanted to see. He gave us estimated time it would take to get the locations, how long he thought the wait we would be on lines, and told us the better places to see at night. Everytime we came in, the staff greeted us with the friendliest smile. Every moring breakfast was prepared and the staff made sure everything was going great for our visit. Highly suggested- very homely feel to this place. Every man at the desk was friendly and great!

Reviews.Title: “good location, lovely staff...”
Reviews.Author: MichelleFraggle
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Giardino really make this hotel great, Tiger is the best host and really helped us with everything we needed, he gave us good reccomendations for places to eat / things to see / do... he even found us a plug converter to borrow so we could charge our camera! We were really grateful! I liked the breakfast area, quite cute and it was nice to speak to other travellers over breakfast, it has a nice relaxed atmosphere. I also liked the fact that our room had a balcony, it had a little lemon tree on it which was lovely, I liked having somewhere in my room to watch the busy, roman world go by! The rooms were clean if a little drab, I mean, the decor was nice but there were a few scuff marks on the wall and the grouting around the bottom of the shower was a bit mildewy - however it was clean, and the daily cleaning service was good. Bed was also comfortable with nice clean sheets. To be fair, this hotel is pretty good value for a really good location, close to all parts of Rome, we walked to pretty mutch everything apart from the Vatican... Although a little tip - bring comfy shoes as walking everywhere is pretty knackering!!! I would definately reccomend this hotel, I think if you are going to do Rome properly, number 1 in your choice of hotel is the location. How long are you going to be spending in your room anyway?! You also have to be realistic with what you expect for what price, and I would always go for friendly staff and cleanliness and over look things like scuff marks on a wall!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lady_A_J
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is set on the first floor of an old building. It is small and cozy and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The room itself was very small with basic, worn out furniture. The bathroom, extremely small but clean an functional. The thing I couldn't get over was the noise coming from the street and from the other rooms. Basic but ok breakfast in a very small room. The biggest plus of this Hotel is its location, very close to Piazza Venezia, via del Corso, via Cavour, via Nazionale. For the price I paid, it was not what I expected, if cheaper I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I can recommend Giardino”
Reviews.Author: Glenn P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Giardino is only a 2-star hotel, so the rooms and comfort could be better. But the hotel is very well situated in Rome - everything is within walking distance. The best to say about Giardino is the level of service! The staff is very friendly and helpful. Another time i may choose to stay a little bit more central and a bit more luxuorius, but Giardino gives full credit for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, lousy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mariabelle
Reviews.Content: I would have given this hotel a terrible if it weren't for the fact that the staff were so nice and helpful or the location so central. Otherwise, I cannot imagine what all the raves are about. In addition, I used Rick Steves guide which gave the hotel a very positive review, so I am not sure I'll ever put my trust in that source again. My room was so small, dark and dingy that it was depressing to retreat to it after a full day. There was no place to put the luggage and the lighting was terrible-I could not read at all in the room. Fresh paint was needed all around. The bathroom had one light out-tough to do makeup. I asked for a new bulb, but it sparked and sizzled and I ended up removing it. The shower was so tiny, only an average size person would fit. The key to the room was problematic and had to be jiggled incessantly to work. The continental breakfast was nothing to write home about. The staff really were lovely and recommended a wonderful place to dine-Santa Cristina restaurant tucked away across the street.That almost made it worthwhile, but I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but”
Reviews.Author: joyce h
Reviews.Content: Yes, you can reach virtually all the places you must see (on foot) from this hotel. I played musical rooms with another guest as we kept trying to find a room we liked. If the furniture wasn't falling on me the bathroom shower flooded. Settled for a room the other guest refused with a bathroom that smelled like a sewer. Annoying keys could take up to 5 minutes to get in or out of the room. Small, dingy, tattered rooms and furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mycousinbrynnie
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is amazing, literally could not have been better. Tiger, at the front desk, almost seemed like he was part of our group! Nice location, in walking distance to many sites. The hotel itself is very cute. Rooms are tiny but bright and clean - we wound up with a balcony so maybe we are a little bit biased but we thought they were great. Air condition works great. Nice continental breakfast. Although there is no elevator, the staff actually helped us carry our bags to and from the second floor. Only downside is the bathroom toilet, the water pressure was so bad the entire time we honestly thought we broke it until we heard other guests commenting on the same thing. Not a deal breaker but definitely worth a heads up!

Reviews.Title: “helpful, but...”
Reviews.Author: 26jpm
Reviews.Content: While it is very true that the English-speaking staff at this hotel provide a very warm welcome and a lot of helpful advice and information, I'm not sure that compensates for the rickety furniture, stained bed coverings, smudged and dirty walls, and threadbare carpets. Try the 3 star across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Valtos
Reviews.Content: Family trip to Rome to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday and third time staying at Hotel Giardino. Rooms were clean, comfy and quiet and service first class at all times. Special thanks to Tyger and his staff who helped us set up a birthday breakfast on the balcony! Nothing was too much trouble and the friendly relaxed ambience made this a real home from home. Ideally situated for visiting the main sites and plenty of restaurants nearby. We did not make the Santa Christina restaurant which came highly recommended but enjoyed an excellent meal at" Wanted".Hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and staff - good value”
Reviews.Author: PegLS
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with my husband in September. Perfect tourist location. Five star staff - the most pleasant and helpful we encountered in Italy. Our room was average size, small bathroom, plenty of hot water and shower pressure, quiet (even though our room was on the street side) with comfortable air conditioning. Breakfast was just ok. Overall, I thought it was a good value in an expensive city, but definitely a budget hotel. Just one more thought. Even with a great hotel location, Rome is a big city, and you do a lot of walking. A wrong turn or long search for a bus stop could waste a lot of time and make you pretty miserable. This was my first trip to Rome, and I did not realize how much I would appreciate having the always available staff give me careful and clear directions whenever I needed them. I wouldn't underestimate how important this can be in helping you get around this busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the friendly staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Frances R
Reviews.Content: This little hotel right by Quirinale and close to the Trevi Fountain is staffed by the loveliest group of young people who are always ready to help out in any way they can. The rooms are small but cute and cosy. It was really easy to get everywhere from here because of the excellent transport options.

Reviews.Title: “So perfect for a couple on a budget-- feels like a splurge with an excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: Sara333W
Reviews.Content: This could not have been a more perfect find for my husband and I on our honeymoon. It is centrally located and you can walk almost everywhere (the Vatican is a bit far, but it is easy to jump on the 40 or 62 bus right from the hotel to get there). The air conditioner was great, and we took full advantage of taking a siesta in our cool room every day. We loved the court yard which had free wifi, and the morning breakfast and cappacino was a great, free way to start your day. The front desk was always so helpful and kind. We would stay at Hotel Giardino again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: Safariste
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful and friendly staff at front desk; fluent English speakers who couldn't have done more to make our visit a success. Excellent location for main Rome sites - easy walk to Colloseum, Trevi fountain, pantheon etc. Rooms basic but clean and comfortable, with some charm. A/C worked fine. Bathrooms larger than typical for cheaper Rome hotels. Ask for a room overlooking the internal courtyard rather than the street which get a lot of street noise (though double glazing makes it quite bearable).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay Great staff”
Reviews.Author: philcentraltexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before leaving for a cruise and 4 additional nights after cruise September 23-29th 2011. If your visiting from the US the accomodations of some of the rooms may be a bit small, but still very nice. We stayed in a different room upon return from the cruise which had a large bathroom almost as big as the room with a window. I think it was room 24. The showers are fairly small by American standards which is common in most hotels. Also common among hotels in Italy is they do not use or provide washcloths. The beds are also somewhat hard not pillowtops for sure. We were so tired most of the time we did not notice. Keep in mind that there is no elevator and its a couple flights of stairs to the rooms. The staff was more than willing to assist but its usually just one staff member there at any given time as the hotel only has 13 rooms. Rooms facing the street side can be somewhat noisy but not a real problem. There is a nice balcony and courtyard area sometimes roped off but the small balcony is part of the hotel and access is always available. Breakfast is great coffee with a roll and crossiant. Corn flakes and granola are avilable as well. There is a small coffee bar/snack shop just two doors down from the hotel and a pizza place across the street. We loved the location not more than a short walk to everything, Its perhaps a 15 min walk to Vatican and Trevi is about 7 min. Rome has lots of steps and you can get turned around with all the little streets so carry a map. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating. Tiger, Mostafa and my apologies I cant remember one name, these guys were the absolute best. Very helpful and went above and beyond. Special thanks to Tiger for making and bringing me coffee to our room, as we arrived late evening in Rome but morning for me. Overall, I would absolutely stay here again, when you come back after a long day its like coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Best Velue, best location, best staff, best of Roma...simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: ShaAvi
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the long review - but I love this place! My mother, sister and I spent 4 days and nights in Rome. It was our first stop in Italy and we were excited to finally visit this magnificent city. I came somewhat prepared (Rick Steves' Italy guide with me) but there is nothing like the first official culture shock when you first land in a new place. We arrived via taxi from the Airport to Hotel Giardino and were immediately impressed. The location is simply amazing! Walking distance to all the central attractions (The Colosseum, the Spanish Steps and so on). We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to see and were only 10min from the Termini Train station. When we didn't want to walk, we took the bus across the street from the Hotel (Via Nazionale). The Roma Pass was a great help. As soon as we arrived to the hotel, we were greeted by Tigar, who was working the day shifts. He was so accommodating and helpful, that is wasn't long before we all became good friends. He not only made our stay pleasant every single day, he want out of his way to insure we had the right directions on the map and the locations of the bus stations and the bus number, not to mention marking the route and where to get off. He made sure to book for us the tickets for the Vatican in advance and schedule an appointment for us at the Galleria Borghese. He advised on the top 10 local lunch/dinner restaurants and Gelato spots and they were all on the money. And all this with a constant smile and great attitude, even when we asked him on a daily basis to go to the trouble of giving us more suggestions and to take out our personals from their safety box and back again. Truly a wonderful Italian hospitality! The rest of the staff was just as wonderful and accommodating. The rooms are a good size, but not big. we stayed at a room with 2 beds (plus additional folded bed for my sister, who only stayed for 3 days) and a bathroom/shower. It was a bit crowded with the extra bed, but still comfortable. It's not too fancy, but has the beautiful classic simplicity of Italian hotels. Beautiful, charming, clean. Since we spent 80% of the time outside our hotel room - all that mattered is that we have a safe, quiet, peaceful, clean place to sleep in and that was close to everything. Breakfast, which is included, was nice as well. Continental, not fancy, with some fresh bread, cereal, cheese, jam, the usual basic and of course coffee per order. We never left hungry. Yes, it was off season, but the price was just amazing for 4 nights, 3 people. we paid 420.00 Euros. Trust me, you can't beat this value...I checked! So don't hesitate, just book it! you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “We've stayed here twice, and will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Bentybeet
Reviews.Content: I love love LOVE Hotel Giardino-Roma. It has the perfect blend of the quaint building, friendly employees, and the most AMAZING location to walk to see the sights. Who could ask for more??

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: BenJo1980
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel in a good location in Rome; this is it. Accommodations are very basic (no frills) and the staff is very friendly and helpful. This was a great place to crash after long days of walking and sight-seeing. It is just a few minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain and only a half a block from the bus stop. My husband loved drinking his cappuccino on the garden patio every morning (continental breakfast included) as we plotted out our plans for the day. I would recommend this hotel to budget travelers (this hotel was much nicer than other budget hotels we have stayed in).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly reception but room not so great”
Reviews.Author: TxTrav1
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was probably the best of any for those wanting to explore the ancient sites of Rome on a budget of about $100 per night. The subway here is not that great in that there are only two lines (the third under construction) and those are mostly on the outskirts of the city. So the primary public transportation is via bus or taxi. Bus 40 from the bus park near the main train station (Roma Termini) will get you to the hotel which is about a 15 min bumpy and crazy ride to the Nazionale stop. From there you walk around the corner and the hotel is on your right with a subtle sign hanging from a balcony. Room was small, but may have been smaller than the others. The bathroom was ridiculously small. Definitely one person only as the toilet was right in front of the sink with maybe two feet between them, then a foot past those was the tiny corner shower. Room was pretty clean, but bathroom and shower were dirty. Single unit a/c worked fairly well but smelled. The room in general was old and musty but was masked by the newer decor. Breakfast was included in the common area or on an outside balcony. Food was better than nothing, but it was basically cheap bread and fake orange juice. Despite all this, Tiger at reception was amazing. Very friendly, kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Would Come Back in a Heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: JenB47
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with accommodations at Hotel Giardino. Everyone at the reception desk - Mostafa, Tiger, and Anna - were helpful and gave us wonderful recommendations for dining and excellent directions. The room was quiet, despite being on a busy road, and the breakfasts were very good. We would defnitely stay here again and also recommend this to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: OneMonthInEurope11
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleased. The staff was so helpful in giving directions, helping with bus and transportation instructions, looking up times and giving advise, and even helped us with our train tickets! They really helped make our time in Rome memorable! The hotel is within easy walking distance of the fountain, colosseum, pantheon etc. The bus is right around the corner for the Vatican. The air condition was so nice. It's clean and our room was not small. The shower is a bit small but typical for European showers as we've seen. The breakfast is great. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The kind of relic you may not want to visit in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TheHoodedBanoonigan
Reviews.Content: Rome is a museum piece, known the world over for its embarassment of cultural treasures and ancient relics. Then, there is Hotel Giardino. Stepping into your room, you will be transported back to 1970 to a time where the thick veneer of moustache and pragmatism might have been able to gloss over the flaws. But 40 years on, and with not a paint job since, this may not be the kind of time travel you were hoping for during your stay in Roma. The yellow walls carry every knock, scrape or bump since time immemorial. The bed is a slab of old tuna covered in the gills of old men. The bidet (where some choose to wash their backside) is where you will find your clean towels in the morning; you'll need to be at your humorous best to stomach that little idiosyncracy. The lights are dim. The bed coverings appear to be old curtains and the curtains, ironically, old bedsheets. There is aircon (sometimes), the TV is modern, and the bathroom only a little dank, but there is no safe (you have to hand over you room key to reception every time you leave the hotel) and no bar fridge to cool your water from the fountains. So why stay here? The location is fantastic. Just seconds from Quirinale Hill (the Presidential Palace, the best sunset in Rome and two of its finest Churches - think Bernini and Borromini) and possibly the best seafood you will eat (Corte del Grillo). The Trevi is no more than a 5 minute walk, the Colosseum, Wedding Cake, Pantheon, Santa Maria della Vittoria all within 10-15 minutes, Piazza Navona 20 and St Peters Square 40. We didnt need a cab once during our stay, nor a bus or train. The 24 hour service is also good, but dont expect any privacy. The breakfast, however, is well below average. The pastries are yesterday's and the powdered orange juice is a memory fit only for school camp. No free wi-fi. Relative to other hotels in Rome, Hotel Giardino seems inexpensive, but we immediately regretted our decision to skimp and would look elsewhere on any future stay; even though we spent very little time in the room, it was an unpleasant retreat whenever we did return. In short, strictly recommended for those looking to stay on a tight budget and prepared for the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it...”
Reviews.Author: jess2767
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I am surprised at how many good ratings this hotel has received. My friend picked this hotel out and booked it for us, and as we stayed here over New Year's, I didn't try to book anything else as all hotels were very expensive. This, too, was really expensive, especially considering it was not as nice as some hostels I have stayed at. I found the rooms to be well-worn and a little bit dirty, and again it was just so expensive considering the rooms were not very nice. The location was good and the staff was pretty nice, but this hotel does not accept credit cards, and my friend and I didn't realize that until we needed to pay. So at 4:30 am, we had to roam around searching for an ATM machine. Perhaps this is posted on their site, but I clearly did not see it and it would have been helpful if they reminded all guests of this fact when they check in. As if to prove my point, literally the next hotel I stayed at during this trip informed me as soon as I checked in that their credit card machine was down. As a result, I was able to prepare for that in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaEdward
Reviews.Content: Located near all tourist sites, a 10 euro cab ride from Roma Temini train station, fair price for accomodation, staff (Tiger) very helpfull and friendly, breakfast room nothing special but for a hotel with 11-12 rooms it was a very pleasurable experience, I would stay again as a value travel. Someone looking for modern experience might look elesewhere

Reviews.Title: “The staff made this a great stay”
Reviews.Author: DarrylBa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It was an easy walk to most of the major sites. The hotel was quaint. The rooms are small, but that seems par for the course. Our room was clean and the breakfast was good. The staff were great! They were very helpful with suggestions on sites, times, directions etc. Tiger always had the weather forcast ready in the morning. They were friendly and it was a pleasure getting to know them.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in central location”
Reviews.Author: eves_g
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a good find. There are so many vastly overpriced places to stay in Rome (as with any major city I suppose) so it's good to know it IS possible to find somewhere to stay that is central, comfortable, clean and doesn't break the bank! Giardino is fantastically located - within walking distance of most of Rome's attractions. The hotel itself is up one flight of stairs on the first floor of the building. Reception is open 24 hours. I have to say, we barely spoke to the staff as we were eager to get out and explore but the guy on reception during our stay was friendly and did offer us help planning our sight-seeing. My boyfriend knows Rome pretty well so we didn't need to take him up on his offer but it was good to know the local knowledge was there if we needed it. Considering our room was one of those coming off the breakfast room, I don't recall much noise at all. Breakfast was a simple continental with bread, cereal, croissants, tea, coffee and fruit juice all on offer. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was a decent size and the room was actually bigger than I expected having read some of the other reviews here mention small rooms. The bathroom was a bit worn. Nothing major wrong but the shower door didn't close properly which resulted in a small pool of water collecting on the bathroom floor outside the shower each time it was used. The bathroom was pretty small too but I don't really see the benefit of having a large bathroom on a city break anyway! The room had a shared balcony outside which wasn't used during our stay (mainly due to the rain!) but I imagine it would be better used for breakfast in the summer months perhaps. On the whole, I'm very glad I found Giardino and I'll certainly be back later this year when I'm next in Rome :o)

Reviews.Title: “The staff made our vacation.....WONDERFUL !”
Reviews.Author: Don_Lisa_Cole
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Giardino made the difference in our dream trip to Rome. The customer service provided by the staff was second to none. The rooms were smaller than I am accustomed to in the states BUT if your going to Rome to spend time in a hotel room....you may want to re-evaluate your plans. During our 11 night stay, Mostafa and Tiger were so helpful in getting around the city and seeing the sites. Florina took such wonderful care of us. She was the first person we saw most mornings at breakfast and was sweet and caring. Jahanger, the overnight young man was literally a life saver. I woke at about 4am during our stay violently ill and knew I needed to go a hospital fast. My husband went to the lobby and Jahanger called me transportation, assisted me to the waiting taxi (I didn't want an ambulance since I thought the siren noise would kill me). He provided the taxi with the info to what we needed and expressed the need to get me there quickly. In about 7 hours when I returned back from the hospital, the rest of the staff was so caring and wonderful, inquiring about how I was feeling and if I needed anything. I cannot say enough good things about the 4 primary staff members we dealt with (Mostafa, Tiger, Florina and Jahanger). We are already planning our next trip to Italy and we will never return to Italy without staying at least a couple of nights at Hotel Giardino.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Cornelia324
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for location and hospitality, especially for Americans. It is not fancy but serves the purpose of good place to stay. The staff is wonderful, kind and very helpful, again with great assistance in English. There are some minor things that could improve the hotel, which I've sent the owners and hopefully they will be implemented as it would cost little and make all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful and Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Vogaris
Reviews.Content: A BIG THANK YOU to Tiger, Mostafa and Anna for making my stay in Rome so much more wonderful! This hotel is well located and is a short walk to wel known Rome attractions Colosseum and Trevi Fountain. The room is nice and well cleaned. The service is simply awesome and the staff are always around to provide great answers to any queries. Food recommendations are delicious and good value for money. My stay coincides with a special day for me and my gf. Upon request and discussion, Tiger and Mostafa decorate the room to together spring a surprise for her. Despite my small budget, the room is very nicely decorated and well surpassses my expectations. My gf is simply delighted and kudos to Tiger and the team. This will definitely be my first choice for my next Rome vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly and serviceminded staff”
Reviews.Author: Spitfire66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and we will not hesitate to come back! The location is perfect in the middle of "everything": About 5 min walk to Fontana di Trevi, 10 min to the Colosseum and the bus stop is just around the corner. We went by bus to the Vatican and to Trastevere just because of the weather but otherwise it is no problem to walk. Everything is within walking distance. The hotel is rated two stars and have rather small simple rooms with ensuite bathrooms (shower) but we had cleaning every day with new towels. We had a room towards the courtyard and it was quiet and clean. The breakfast was served by the host every day and included youghurt, tea/coffee (espresso, capuccino available), orange juice, a croissant and a bagel, sufficient for us. One night we had bought some wine and cheese and when we asked for a wineopener we got a whole tray with plates, wine glasses etc - good service! The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful and very well familiar with the places worth to see in Rome and how to get there. Don't hesitate to ask! They also provide printer service and help you to book tickets, taxi and so on. Thanks to Tiger in the reception for all help and inside tips! Our tips in Rome: 1. A very nice restaurant just nearby Fontana di Trevi called Spiriti e Forme (Vicolo Scavolino 63) where we were served the best meal on our stay. Good prices, nice staff and excellent food and wine. 2. Book your tickets to the Vatican in advance otherwise you might be stuck in line for several hours. Take a break between the Sistine Chapel and the Basilica of Saint Peters and go to a nearby restaurant (about 5 min) called the Passaguai (via Pomponio Leto 10). High quality food! We had some great wine and chévre there. 3. If you want to take a peaceful walk, visit the Aventines and take a look in the Aventine keyhole and see Saint Peters far away. Nice quiet neighbourhood (at least in March...) with surrounding orange trees and nice view over Trastevere (Piazza dei Cavalieri di Malta). 4. Do not go to Porta Portese market. Highly overrated. 5. Skip the hop on-hop off buses. Everything is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The best way to start a trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: katieham
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I loved Hotel Giardino, especially Tiger, who speaks fluent English and works at the front. Tiger was warm and welcoming and provided us with the best food recommendations in Italy. Not only were they delicious recommendations, but they were also in our price range. I'd highly recommend Hotel Giardino for the location, hospitality, and cleanliness! Thank you for all of your help, Tiger!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff”
Reviews.Author: susanwalsh
Reviews.Content: The staff at this little hotel are delightful and great on advice for restaurants and transport. Tiger is so nice and carried my case up and down for me. The breakfast is adequate and always nicely presented. Perhaps the quality of the orange juice could be improved? A bit more attention to detail in shower doors and the wall paintwork would be good but our room was comfortable and the bed was fine. Free wifi is a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Fearghal324
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really do care about helping you enjoy your stay at Rome. When arriving we asked for advice on sight seeing and only too helpfull to show us were to go, we returned that night and asked about dinning advice, and to be honest i do not believe we would have found any better a restuarant in Rome, than their advice. The location of this hotel is fantastic, its about 50m from the resident of the president of Napoli, and 10 min walk to both the colosium, trevi fountain and spanish step. Would highly recomend this to any couple wishing to do alot of sight seeing and using the room for sleeping in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: acwpogi
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Giardino. I came back because I was very pleased the first time. As other reviewers have noted, the location is fantastic- it's about a 5-minute walk from the Trevi Fountain and a reasonable walk to many of Rome's other main tourist sites. You can even walk to the Termini Station w/in 15 minutes, but there are buses that will take you there as well. The value is incredible- very reasonably priced for its location. The free breakfast was decent, but no frills. The rooms were rather plain and the bed was the typical hard European type you'll experience over here. But the rooms and hotel are clean, the staff is helpful, and the neighborhood is relatively quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travlinmegs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my parents for a couple days while on vacation and really enjoyed it. The location is fantastic-- walking distance to the Colusseum and Forum as well as the Trevi fountain, etc... the list goes on. The staff was extremely helpful and even allowed us to do online check-in and print our boarding passes for our flights. We would definitely stay here again if we're ever back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, very accommodating staff, great value!”
Reviews.Author: GotTheTravelBug20
Reviews.Content: Tiger, front desk staff, was the friendliest, one of the most helpful individuals we've met on our travels. He always had a huge small, was most knowledgeable and eager to please. The breakfast was a great way to start our day. Again, the staff did everything to ensure your comfort. The location was walking distance to the Colleseum and Forum and there was a tourist info shop a few blocks away. Transit was steps away, although we walked everywhere. The presidential palace was up the block, Trevi fountain another block further and we walked to Pantheon and Spanish Steps too! Even Vatican City was one bus ride away. Great location, great value, great staff. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “The location and service was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny198707
Reviews.Content: When beeing in Rome and staying at Hotel Giardino you have walk distance to almost everything, which we appreciated very much. But the best thing about the hotel was the staff that answered all of our questions with kindness and helpfulness - just as any hotel or hostel should do. I would strongly recommend any to come and stay at your place in "La Roma"!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: spaniel44
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I had never been to Rome and the people at Hotel Giardino were not only helpful but they were energetic and fun to be around. They patiently explained where to catch a bus, where the internet cafes were and the locations of the good restaurants in town. They made our vacation one we will always remember!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: wm49555
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giardino was fantastic. The location is right in the middle of where you want to be (Rome is actually very walkable, everything is a 5 - 15 minute walk from this hotel. A great breakfast every morning, consisting of breads, jams, coffees, and teas (Typical Italian breakfast). The staff was more than eager to help you out, especially Tiger. Three out of the four staff we encountered spoke fluent English, one of the overnight guys seemed a little newer to the language. The rooms are smaller and the bathrooms tinier than most places in the US, but that is the trend there. This hotel was everything we needed and the price (Rome hotels are expensive) was right. The double pane windows blocked out 95% of the street noise so that wasn't a problem. If the price is right at the time, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tippet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Giardino October 13 through the 15th based on tripadvisor reviews and Rick Steves guidebook. Our room was very plain, no frills and basic. Two twin beds. What really shines at this hotel is the staff. Nikola, Tiger and Anna all spoke very good english and were very helpful with advice on getting around and where to eat etc. They really went the extra steps to insure that your concerns were addressed in a positive manner. Nikola even let us use the Hotel's only computer to print out our airline boarding passes before we departed. Thanks Nikola! The Hotel location cannot be beat. We walked everywhere except one cab ride to the Borghese Gallery. The staff can call cabs for you and they arranged our ride to the airport coming home. The cab driver actually called the hotel to say he was there and came up the two flights of stairs to the hotel desk and carried our two bags down stairs and out to the cab. That is service! Considering the price for hotel rooms in Rome this place is a real find. The continental breakfast was adequate with coffee, croissants, breads, hot chocolate, etc. Enough to get you on your way for the day. They have WiFi if you have your own computer but no computer for hotel guests. They can direct you to the nearest Computer Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: seatraveler27
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Giardino! The staff was very responsive and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We were able to walk to the Colloseum, Trevie Fountain, and many other nearby attractions. Breakfast was good and Nikola (manager) was very knowledgable and helped us tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: dpk49d
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thouroughly enjoyed our stay at the Giardino. The front desk staff were so helpful and courteous that we felt that some American hotel people could learn from them. Their service with regards to getting around the city was above average. The location was very good for getting around the city by foot and we only took a bus once because of the ease of getting around from the hotel. The room was neat and clean and good for what we wanted - inexpensiv, clean and centrally located. The breakfast served is a Continental breakfast and was very adequate. My wife and I really have nothing negative to say about the hotel and cannot therefore say what we liked the least.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: glac99
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. Bus stop around the corner from the hotel. 10 minute walk to Roma Termini for the Metro (or bus ride). Also, a good location for walking to the sights (i.e., campo de fiori, piazza navona, pantheon and trevi fountain areas, etc.). Free Wi-Fi and helpful staff. Very small room, but fine for a solo traveler. Cons: I stayed in the first room at the top of the flight of stairs, and it was quite noisy. Hotel is at a busy intersection so traffic was present essentially all night. Not enough of an issue for a room change, but you might want to ask before booking a room about the noise. Also, you must ring a buzzer to gain entrance and then climb a flight of stairs to reach hotel level. Not an issue for me, but maybe for some.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pinchi1
Reviews.Content: Located in the centre of everything rome has to offer. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were very basic, and small but for the price and location that wasn't an issue. No elevator access (something to consider if you have heavy bags) but only 1 flight of stairs. Free wifi and a decent free breakfast. You wont regret it if it's budget Roman accommodation you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “One of best choice”
Reviews.Author: uglyducky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Giardino 3 nights in September.Everything was perfect.First I have to thank all staff of Giardino.Kindly and helpful.Room was clean,silent and safe.Very close to major touristic attractions and train station.If you need only sleep in clean and safe room why you should pay more?

Reviews.Title: “Read about Hotel Giardino in Rick Steves...”
Reviews.Author: Xxsarahmayxx
Reviews.Content: Read about Hotel Giardino in Rick Steves' Rome book, so we knew what to expect-simple, but clean, great location and excellent service. Got a discount with Rick Steves book and by paying in cash. We were VERY impressed with the customer service all employees spoke English well and were very friendly and helpful (directions, calling cabs, making dinner reservations, even helped us with our Roma Pass-we forgot to pick it up at the airport and they called and we picked it up at the Tourist Info around the corner). We would recommend to friends and stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are extremely friendly - even before you arrive!!!”
Reviews.Author: triptravel2597
Reviews.Content: I haven't even arrived at the hotel yet, and the staff has been very helpful answering my questions about the -train-bus travel options from the airport. I have received at least 3-4 emails from them within minutes of my asking a question! I am looking forward to a very friendly experience when I arrive on October 22. It is so refreshing to see a business that is so focussed on the customer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, charming hotel, friendly staff, overall a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: asemm33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I was looking for. A central location, nice rooms, AIR CONDITIONING, extremely friendly staff who start to learn your names after one day of being there. The Breakfast in the morning was wonderful, I loved eating out on the little terrace. The staff are so friendly and will help you find anything or anyplace you need or want to go. The rooms are perfect, and the price is affordable. We really enjoyed our stay here I would recommend this to anyone that is going to Rome that wants a great location for a great price plus friendly staff that really go out of there way to help you. I recommended this hotel to my parents who are venturing to Rome in April. We will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Aloha0706
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty centrally located. Rooms were clean but bathrooms could use some TLC(remodling). Rooms had a/c - which is a must in Italy in July. Staff was FANTASTIC!! Let me say that again...STAFF WAS FANTASTIC..especially Mustafa!! He went out of his way to make our stay very special. Aloha from the The Reuschel's (Hawaii, USA)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: manfri096
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Giardino is a classic hotel. The location is just incredible since you can go to all the major attractions by walking (coloseum, trevi fountain, forums, spanish steps, navona square and Pantheon). The room we stayed in was not particularly fancy or big but it was extremely clean. The big plus of this little hotel is the staff. Always smiling and willing to help you with anything, more like a concierge service. The Giardino was the first hotel we stayed in Rome as they were fully booked for the extra days they suggest us another nearby hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: malloyma
Reviews.Content: What made this hotel such a great value was a combination of the extremely friendly, helpful staff, and the location. The staff helped with maps, restaraunts, buses, and arranging tickets and taxis. The location is within easy walking distance to most of the major attractions of Rome. Although the rooms are small, and maybe a little dark, they are clean and comfortable. How much time would you spend in your room anyway, when you are in Rome?!? AC was wonderful during the hot afternoons for a siesta. The bar downstairs has the best Cappichinos. Giardinos even stored our luggage between trips to Rome; we stayed there 3 times during the month visit to Italy. We would absolutely recommend this hotel; they made our trip to Rome even more wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Snickers31
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for somewhere to stay on a budget that has clean rooms, great customer service, and is centrally located...then this is the place to stay. It's no frills. We stayed in several cities and quite notably the staff at Hotel Giardino was the friendliest and most accommodating. They bent over backwards to help us get directions, information, etc. Breakfast is basic and just as good as any other hotel. With so much to see in Rome you really don't spend any time in your room except to sleep. I guess the downside is it very small and there really isn't any view to speak of (although we did have a quaint terrace to eat on each morning) and there is no lobby just a desk.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, engaging and knowledgeable staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Molly41742
Reviews.Content: We will definitely return to Hotel Giardino. The staff made the visit much easier and a lot more enjoyable. I say easier because there was a heat wave when we were in Rome. (The hotel's air conditioning works!) Big cities are brutal in the heat, but the staff had great suggestions for shortcuts down hidden stairways to save us some walking. Those stairways led us to neighborhoods and hip restaurants that we probably wouldn't have found on our own. They were also very knowledgeable about all public transportation routes, even showing us the routes on the computer. It's not a fancy hotel, but we prefer to spend money in the little trattorias and cafes. Very clean (lovely bath gel) and delicious breakfasts. Prepare yourself for a real cup of coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Dark, small, oppressive”
Reviews.Author: Thoxy
Reviews.Content: We are usually quite pleased with Rick Steve's suggestions. In this case, we were amazed at how wrong he was. The service was extremely unfriendly, the rooms were tiny, dark, and noisy (if you are on the street side), and the breakfast room was tiny, unkempt, and dirty. The street is loud and busy. It is much better to stay a bit farther off the beaten track and walk the extra few blocks to find a more gracious and similarly priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Kazhj
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Giardino perfectly located for everything we wanted to see; so many sites were walkable, and very convenient to bus/metro for farther flung locations. So, that in itself makes Giardino a place to recommend without hesitation. Let me add the 24-hour availability of staff; their welcoming attitude and their willingness and desire to help us with anything and everything. You cannot go wrong. Particularly adored Tiger and Mustafa, just because they were on duty for most of our stay. We wll definintely return to Hotel Giardino on any future trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I was treated like traveling royalty.”
Reviews.Author: tsperlich
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the care we got at this hotel. They took care of all of our needs. They booked tours, called taxis, got our luggage in our room for us while we were out, and well, the list goes on and on. Everybody was kind, friendly, extremely helpful and reliable. It was close enough to walk to most things and half a block from an atm, a bus stop, vending machines and restaurants. It was just a few blocks from the coll. and forum. It wasn't fancy, but the beds were comfortable, the rooms nicely air conditioned, breakfasts tasty, location great, clean, but most of all just really great care from those working there. They let us use their computer to check into airline and to make bookings, too.

Reviews.Title: “Please Keep This A Secret”
Reviews.Author: OEK
Reviews.Content: Okay, if Rick Steves had kept this a secret, I would not have discovered it. But, I don't want to say too much, because when I come back this is definitely where I will be staying. Plus, I don't want them to raise the prices by becoming too popular. But in all fairness, they were all awesome and you can't beat their service, attitude, or accommodations. This is the best of all worlds: location, cleanliness, ambiance, pricing, and comfort. They make you feel very welcome and they are happy to help you find anything your looking for, including the best Jelatos. So if you want to spend your money on dinner, sightseeing, etc., this is one place that will make your money go farther without sacrificing the comforts of home. Hey Tiger, you're the best!!! Sincerely, your new BFFs from Florida

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: SistersIdaho
Reviews.Content: This is a Two Star hotel that tries hard to please. Best for location, and for staying one or two nights. Good cappucinno for breakfast with usual yogurt and packaged breads included in the price. Wonderful welcoming staff helped us with luggage and served our needs in a pleasant manner.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel to stay at while seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: nancyH60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, but very centrally located, GREAT STAFF, nice rooms and yummy breakfast. We had a wonderful two day stay, the staff went out of their way to be helpful in recomending restaurants, getting us train schedules,calling cabs and getting us whatever we needed. Our room was off a interior courtyard that was extremely pleasant to sit in after a day of site seeing or drinking your morning coffee. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob423
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and was somewhat dismayed to find that there was no elevator to the hotel located one level above the street. We started to haul our bags up but the hotel rep on duty came down and hauled several of the heavy bags himself - he was most helpful and an example of the outstanding service we experienced during our stay. Our room was modern with a balcony overlooking the street and the other couple we were traveling with had a larger balcony overlooking a foyer area surrounded by buildings (see photo). The private bath and shower was fine and the room also had a flat screen TV but we never turned it on. We ate the included breakfast on their balcony (croissant, roll, orange juice, coffee and assorted jellies and other spreads). We originally chose the hotel because it's within walking distance to the antiquities, to the Colosseum and the Trevi Fountain. Also, by taking bus #40 at the stop across the street you can ride to the Vatican, very convenient. We felt very secure in the hotel. The desk is manned 24 hours a day and they will make reservations for you at a restaurant or order a taxi. All the rooms doors are within view of the desk clerk, it is not a large hotel. As the final plus, it had free HiFi for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Awesome Staff Make Hotel Giardino a Place Worth Staying”
Reviews.Author: luchini424
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Italy on what was going to be a brief vacation, but due to the Icelandic volcano activity, I was "stuck" in Rome for an additional 5 nights. Not knowing exactly where to go, I returned to the hotel I stayed at previously a short distance from Hotel Giardino. Overnight, the rates doubled and I had to find a new hotel. While searching for hotels in Rome at the internet cafe, I stumbled across Hotel Giardino and I'm very glad I did. The Staff - The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly. From the moment I checked in, they knew my situation (with the volcano) and knew that the situation was constantly changing. Rather than lock me into a reservation, they allowed me to play it by ear until I could get a flight home. They even accomodated a fellow stranded traveler from my hometown. I can not speak highly enough about them... Location - The location, right off of via Nazionale is only a short walk from pretty much everything. The Colloseum is about a 10 minute walk, the Forum about the same. Plenty of resraurants around on Via Serpenti, Via Boschetto and Via Cavour. Just outside of Hotel Giardino is a small coffee shop with food and more importantly - Caffe Irlandese. The hotel is also easily acessible from the Metro (Cavour or Republicca). Rooms - Rooms are average but very clean. The rooms are very quiet and you won't have any problems getting a good night's rest for the following day. In short, if you are looking for a good hotel, with a great staff in an excellent location- Hotel Giardino is it.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Lystrata
Reviews.Content: The three main reasons I recommend this hotel are the exceptional staff, the comfortable, but not luxurious, rooms, and the splendid location. The staff went out of their way to assist me in numerous ways during my nine day stay. The breakfast served in the restuarant / lobby area was a good start for the day. Every evening when I returned I felt like I was going to my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay at hotel giardino”
Reviews.Author: heightsfive
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Giardino. The location was superb – we walked to all the sights except for Vatican City. Our rooms were very comfortable and spotless, the breakfast was simple and delicious. And most of all, the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They helped us with train schedules, bus tickets, taxis, directions and more! We will definitely come back to the Hotel Giardino!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: howardjohnCa
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giardino was terrific. Staff was very accomodating and friendly. Location is great, very easy to get around. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location but the rooms could use some improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Charlie0326
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviews stated the location is amazing. If you do not stay in this hotel I highly recommend staying in this area because most major sights (except the Vatican) are a 5-20 minute walk. You can take a bus to the Vatican which takes about 20 minutes. A nice feature about this hotel is they have a collection of Rome/Italy guide books that other travelers have left behind that you can use if you didn't bring your own. This hotel is a Rick Steeves recommendation which is evident in the fact that at every table in the breakfast room an American traveler was clutching one of his books. Our room was pretty quiet. The bed wasn't very comfortable, I could feel each of the springs digging into my back. The toilet was constantly running and the bathroom needed a good cleaning with mildew remover and CLR. The shower changed water pressure and temperature to drastic (and dangerous) extremes during a ten minute shower which was a complaint we heard from other travelers in the breakfast room. Only Italian TV stations which is not a big deal but my mom likes to watch TV to help her sleep. But in Rome you should be out and about, not spending your time in a hotel. This is the location you want to be in if you can get past the less comfortable aspects of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip, excellent hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: TgyManchester
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great, warm and welcoming. The staff was more than willing to help us with directions which was more often than not. The rooms were nice and cozy, extremely quite at night, clean. Extremely nice considering the price and the central location of the hotel. The service was was pretty much impeccable, the staff help us organize our trip and book the bus to naples. the best part would probably be the location of the hotel and how welcoming they made us feel. Over all it was a great experience and i would advise it for anyone who is looking for a hotel in the city center!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location to see it all in a quick visit”
Reviews.Author: IowaHoneymooners2010
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful in outlining all the sites to see. Breakfast was OK, but sufficient. One downside was that they didn't offer a complimentary computer for guests. They did let us use the front desk computer for directions to our next city and to check in our flight on the last night. We stayed here at the beginning of our trip and the last night. The first room was really small, but the windows are completely sound proof and we got a great night's sleep after a long international flight. The beds were very comfortable. The location is what we liked most about this hotel. Its close proximity to the major sites allowed us to see a lot (walking and by bus) in a very short amount of time. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: cwagk19
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in February 2010 and had a great time! The staff was amazing and extremely helpful! They even helped us look up and printed off times and prices for a day trip to Florence! I would agree that the breakfast isn't much - a roll, croissant, plain cereal and coffee, but that wasn't a deal breaker for us! The room was small but if you go a little later the number of tables wasn't a problem. One problem with our room was the shower - it would go from hot to luke warm/cold every couple of minutes. They attempted to fix it but it didn't work. We didn't bother asking to change rooms because we didn't want to spend our time there packing back up and changing but I'm sure it wouldn't have been a problem. Other than that the room was fine. Large size and picked up/cleaned daily. the location of this hotel is WONDERFUL!! 5 min walk to Trevi Fountain, another 5 or so to Pantheon, 10 min to Colesseum, 10 to Termini, and about 10 to Spanish Steps! Vatican is about a 25-30 min walk but very easy! Great central location near all the sites and restaurants/shops (near Trevi - Pantheon area). If you want a nice hotel in a very central location to all the sites of Rome, this is a good place for you! Don't expect much for breakfast other than something small/lite to hold you until lunch. Another perk was the 24hr service. Since there was an attendant 24 hours a day, it didn't matter what time you arrived from site-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Generally disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Celeste29
Reviews.Content: I was quite disappointed with this hotel after having read so many positive reviews about it. The first room that we were given was not very clean and it was right next to the reception area, so was quite noisy. The décor of the room was tired with scuffed walls and cracked tiles in the bathroom. We changed to another room the next day and it was much the same with the added bonus of a bathroom that smelt of mildew! The breakfast area was tiny, only three tables. There were a few more tables in the outdoor patio area but, as we went in winter, it was not in use. This meant that some guests arrived for breakfast and had to go back to their room and wait for a free table! I agree with most other comments in that the location was excellent and the staff were friendly and helpful. However, the general impression was that the hotel has not been adequately maintained over the years, and has most definitely lost its luster.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super staff with clean well-sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: BevinandJeff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Giardino for a long weekend. It was a very central location, easy to get to from Termini and then within walking distance to all thigns Roma! The rooms were clean and of good size. Our washroom was nice and big, the shower has low pressure but if that is the only thing wrong, it is a great hotel. The breaksfast that is served in the mornings is a great way to start a day of touring. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, rather small”
Reviews.Author: ScaryMissMary
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderfull location, very central, all major places of interest are within walking distance but public transportation is only a few steps away if you wish. Staff were very pleasant and professional; when I arrived they had kind of 'lost' my reservation but it was no problem at all, I was immediatly given a room anyway and even offered the choice between two of them. I went for an internal room as I thought it would be quieter, it was quiet but giving off a rather ugly internal courtyard full of scafflding, no big deal if you are not there for the view. I booked a single room which had a double bed and was quite spacious for one person (even if the bathroom was tiny), I hope double rooms are larger and have bigger wardrobes. Room and bathroom were very clean even if furniture looks oldish and in not the best of shape. The breakfast room is rather small too, only 4 tables; you get a decent choice: yoghurt, 2 types of cereals, assorted jams, nutella, honey, butter (Lurpack my favourite!), some biscuits, and you also get a hot beverage of your choice, a croissant and bread bun.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Potters50England
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at end of January. Room medium sized but always clean and always plenty of hot water in bathroom. Breakfast fine and room service drinks very reasonable (1euro for cappucino). Staff very friendly and helpful. There is always someone on reception. If you get a choice ask for a room on the courtyard side as road noise can be rather loud at certain times of the day. If you want a good pizzeria try Est Est Est on Via Genova (5 mins walk from hotel). Great atmosphere and good food at very reasonable prices. TIp get there when they open at 7pm or reserve a table. Altogether a brill 1st trip to Rome. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money - great location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sarazu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Giardino with my boyfriend for 3 nights. The location was GREAT. Room and bathroom were nice and clean. Good value for money. Have a look at the website: that is what you'll find. Breakfast is OK: espresso/cappuccino/hot chocolate/tea, bread, croissant, cereals, milk, yoghurt, marmalade, nutella, honey, juice from concentrate. It could be better though (e.g. fresh fruit, cheese, ham). The staff is really friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly home base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: olivesandwine
Reviews.Content: Relying on Rick Steves' recommendation, we spent the week at Hotel Giardino. We reserved several months ahead of time, and made frequent requests for them to arrange for tours and museum reservations. When we arrived, everything was in place as promised. What's more, they welcomed us like family. Our room was ready for our early morning arrival. Recognizing how weary we were from our long journey, they delivered coffee and breakfast to our room. Throughout the week, they continued to be gracious, generous, and helpful. The room was small, tidy, meticulously clean, well appointed and lacked nothing. Though all of the staff was efficient and beyond reproach, Giovanni's cheerful assistance was particularly endearing.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quaint and comfortable hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: mgb330
Reviews.Content: Read about this suggested economical lodging in Rick Steve's guidebook and then took to Trip Advisor to get her blessing, as this great service has not steered me off course yet. The rooms are small, but the bed very comfortable. The staff is incredibly quick to help you sort out tour plans, give bus and metro information and or make great restaurant suggestions. Breakfast consists of cereal with milk, yoghurt, orange-flavored drink, choice of coffee (the cappucino is quite delicious), croissants, rolls, jam and other condiments. The bakery is fresh and ample to get you through to dinner if you take a light snack during the day. From this hotel it is easy to walk to the colosseum, forum, pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and plenty of good shopping (souvenir and or ritzier boutiques). Take the number #64 or #40 bus less than a half block from the hotel to get to the must-see Vatican. Or walk a few blocks to take the Repubblica stop metro to the Borghese Museum (make a reservation well in advance for this place). For dinner you can take the #64 two stops to the delicious and wildly popular with the locals, Da Baffetto. The only drawbacks about the hotel would be the following: there is no elevator so you will have to walk up a flight and a half each time you come back; there is no in-room safe; it is on a noisy and busy street, but the thick windows seem to stifle the loudness quite well; and the shower does this quirky thing where every couple of minutes the water turns ice cold for three seconds or so. But you cannot beat this hotel for location and value. I'd definately go back again. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giardino----great things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: marthacarlson
Reviews.Content: Our family of four--two college age kids--stayed for a week at Hotel Giardino over the Christmas holiday and in large it part made our first European trip a fantastic success. With only twelve rooms, it has the feel of staying with family. The rooms are a little small but plenty for our needs, and the service makes it five-stars in our view. From Giovanni at the desk, who from the first email query from us was outstanding, to Florina, who kept our room clean and served us breakfast, our experience there was excellent. As for the location: ten minutes walk uphill to Trevi Fountain, ten minutes walk downhill to the Coliseum, fifteen minutes walk to the train station---who could ask for more. Felt pampered, safe, and well-attended. For those who want a true feel for Rome and are not interested in the trappings of grand style, Hotel Giardino is for you!!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoy it”
Reviews.Author: Umals
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Gianluca, Fiorella, Giovanni and... (sorry if we've forgotten some name). Accomodation and service at the hotel were really friendly. Braziliani regards, Gian e Ana

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ninebark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Giardino for 4 nights in December. Everything in the hotel was clean and comfortable. Our room faced an interior courtyard so was very quiet. The room was a bit on the small side but satisfactory. There was no in room safe but the room itself was very secure. There was someone at the desk all 24 hours and each of the staff that we dealt with was friendly, spoke english, and helped us in arranging taxis, making reservations, etc. The breakfast was average but adequate with coffee, juice, rolls, yogurt and cold cereals. The hotel was especially kind in packing us a bag breakfast our last morning since we had an early morning flight. Although the room was clean, some things in the room were very dusty and there was a little bit of mildew in the bathroom. Nothing serious, but someone with dust or mildew problems might have issues. Also, a small issue, the hotel uses a battery operated room deodorizer which sent out annoying plumes we did not like - it was much better once we took the batteries out and aired out the room. This is an excellent value in a great location in Rome, near to many of the best sights like the Pantheon. The area seemed safe to walk around at night. If I were to return, I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple central hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinIre
Reviews.Content: If you are lucking for luxury, this is the wrong place for you. But if you are looking for a very central hotel which is clean and good value, then this fits the criteria. The staff in this hotel are excellent - very helpful, friendly and are happy to give good tips for your excursion and dining. We felt very at home here. The rooms were simple but cosy and clean. Location is great - only used the bus once in three days as the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain and other attrations are within 10 minute walk from the hotel. Good value for Rome. Would come back again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Rome's attractions”
Reviews.Author: SuzieMac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean with very good service and staff who are very helpful regarding accessing the many attractions Rome has to offer. The hotel is well situated if you want to use the excellent bus service or railway station. Although our stay was short, the impression made by the staff and hotel will encourage us to book again and to recommend it to friends and family. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: wombat11
Reviews.Content: Recommended by Rick Steve's Rome book. We enjoyed our stay here. Great location, easy to walk to major sights, great value, and nice staff. Accommodations were humble - small rooms, tiny shower, but overall clean and quite and inexpensive. We spent most of our time out in the city so we only used the hotel primarily as a place to sleep and it was perfect for it. Staff had good recommendations for restaurants and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This small hotel in the heart of Rome is clean and has excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: frogstar168
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Giardino for 7 nights while we toured Rome. It is an intimate B&B that is walking distance from most of the sights and museums. There is great dining all around. Our room was big enough for the two of us, with an adequate bed and shower. We were served cereal, yogurt, excellent coffee and rolls every morning by a very nice lady. Jean Luca, Davide and Giovanni, at the front desk, were very professional, kind and helpful. They speak fine English and gave us many good recommendions for sight-seeing, dining and shopping. Giovanni even taught me a little Italian. They also sell public transportation tickets at the front desk. Hotel Giardino is a wonderful place to stay and rest while experiencing Rome. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MichPier
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hotel Giardino made our first trip to Rome wonderful. The rooms were clean and all of our needs were met. Views and location were also very convenient. I would recommend the hotel to all travelers. Thanks to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Easy location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: lindsayBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a very central location. We met up with a Roman friend and he commented on what a great location it is. It's right on the #64 and #40 bus line, which goes to St Peter's and is a great way to get across town. The room was simple, no luxuries. The bathroom was relatively new and more spacious than some others we experienced. The room faced the back of the building and was very quiet. We were right next to reception, so I was afraid it might be noisy, but it was fine. The bed was relatively comfortable. I expected simple, so the room met those expectations. The only complaint was it smelled of smoke, despite it being a non-smoking room. Breakfast was included and pretty good: coffee, break, croissant, cereal, yogurt. The front desk was helpful with anything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Christinef44
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giardino was a charming little hotel right within walking distance to just about everything. This was the only hotel on our 4 week trip to Italy that had a quiet and functioning air conditioning and it was the least expensive. The rooms were small, but clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would highy recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: italyreview09
Reviews.Content: spent 5 nights here... location is AMAZING. centrally located and an easy walk to every major site that you want except the vatican, which has an easy bus that has a stop literally around the corner. rooms are small but perfectly fine. nice staff. very clean. only annoyance is if too many people put the AC too high, it blows the power in the hotel and the first night the power kept shutting off! but they turn it right back on. but that only happened the first night. overall, hotel is very clean and rooms are perfectly fine, and the good value and amazing location put it over the top.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gee1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and my two teenage girls spent three days in Rome before taking a cruise. I'm very glad we stayed at Hotel Giardino. The service was excellent. The hotel is more like a bed and breakfast. The front desk had someone on duty at all times. You leave your key with them when you leave your room. It was like having a concierge. Because none of my family spoke Italian nor had friends in Rome, we were vulnerable tourists. I felt like the staff at Giarduno helped keep us from being taken advantage of as tourists. The Hotel staff gave us restaurant recommendations, suggestions on how to tour the city, what to see, why to see it, and even ordered limo service for us to the boat and to the airport after our return on the cruise at half the cost of the cruise-line. They hire very nice people to staff their front desk. The hotel is nice and clean, but the rooms are quite small--but sweet. I looked forward to their tasty, light breakfast each morning. They had Rome travel books in their library so don't pack yours! There was a TV in the common area where they were fine with our watching the news in English. They even heated up my leftovers, and usually had cokes and beers on hand when we were tired from touring. The downside is that there is no elevator so be prepared to haul your bags up lots of stairs. The place is within walking distance to Trevi fountain, the Coloseum, and I think we even walked back to our room from the Spanish steps. We hopped the bus to the Vatican at a bus-stop right out front of the hotel. The hotel's location is excellent. We had to rent two rooms so it was a bit pricier for our family, but we were glad we had the two rooms once we saw how small the rooms were. We traveled with a single mom and her two sons, and they were able to fit comfortably in one of the hotel's larger rooms. We booked about six months in advance and already the larger room was booked.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: familytime01
Reviews.Content: Just returned a week ago from our trip to Italy. We stayed four nights at the Hotel Giardino and I am so glad we did. You can't beat the location. We walked to most every location we were interested in seeing such as the Trevi Fountain, Colliseum, Roman Forum, Pantheon, and the Spanish steps. Easy to reach the metro or the bus as well for farther places like the Vatican or Villa Borghese. And I always felt safe, especially noting that the police station is just around the block!! The rooms were very quiet for sleeping, especially for a busy city like Rome. The double paned windows keep out all the noise, and I am a light sleeper. During the day we sometimes kept them open to just hear the hustle and bustle of the city, but at night, the air-conditioning went on and the windows were closed. The best part of the hotel though is the staff. The guys were always available especially for the myriad questions we had and requests for tea, hot chocolate, cappucino!! They were always ready with a map to show directions, advice with restaurants they enjoyed , or where the local laundry facility was. They even got on the phone for us to help interpret with Italian relatives we were to meet but neither my husband nor I speak Italian!! You just have to remember that, as the hotel web site states, you have to walk up a flight of stairs to the hotel and the rooms are moderate to small in size. And the showers are not meant for large people. Those are the only things that I would point out as possible down sides for some people. But I enjoyed it. Otherwise, I could have just traveled locally if I wanted a plush hotel with amenities. And the web site photos look just the same in person, cute little balcony and breakfast room with plenty of croissants, rolls, cereal, cappucino, yogurt, tea- just enough to get the day going. We booked two rooms as we traveled with teens ages 13 and 17 and we all enjoyed our stay. Thanks again guys for making our stay so enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “For Budget Travelers Only”
Reviews.Author: BluestarBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We chose this 3-star hideaway based on Rick Steves’ recommendation. His positives about the hotel are right on the money: cost, location, and friendy staff. For Rome, the cost is extremely affordable. Location was central – we walked everywhere. And the two gentlemen we dealt with over our two-night stay were exceptionally helpful and friendly. There were none of the fears we experienced at other hotels about leaving our belongings in the room or getting ripped off by a shifty checkout person. However, this is still a 3-star hotel in Rome (very different from 3-star hotel in, say, Florence). Know that you are getting what you pay for. The showers were not as clean as one might expect – my wife refused to take a shower. One side of our towel rack was broken and hung down from the wall. Tiles were cracked. In fact, I felt like I was in a public washroom. Within the room itself, the walls were scuffed. Rugs were ragged and filthy. And it was the only hotel of all our hotels in Italy that did not have International CNN – not normally a factor except that there was such scant light in each of our two rooms (we switched after the first night thinking we had drawn the dungeon room) that it was near impossible to read a book or crib in our journals. We would recommend this place for those folks who are most concerned about those strengths outlined above. This is most definitely a budget hotel. Additionally, if you are a Rick Steves-type traveller, you will find more of your kind here. We took in the free breakfast on our first morning and sat in a side room about the size of a mini-van in which two couples from the American Midwest traded Vatican-visiting tips in voices far too loud for 8 a.m. (we could even hear them from our hotel room!). I exaggerate for effect since they were otherwise decent people -- perhaps just a little too enthusiastic for me. If you are an enthusiastic budget traveller, then the Hotel Giardino is for you. A nice alternative to having breakfast at the hotel is stopping by a café around the corner called “Theatre Café” (frequented by carabineri and students), where you can catch a glimpse of real Romans starting their day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fortwothtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location- just a short walk to ancient Rome, the pantheon, trevi fountain and the Spanish steps...essentially close to everything. It is also right on a major bus route that will take you right to the vatican. It is a great value for the location. The staff is all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladytripping
Reviews.Content: I have been in Rome for a short break with my boyfriend. It is not the first time that I visited Rome, but the last time I did not stay in this lovely little hotel. The location is amazing. One of the best spot where to start to visit all the main monuments in Rome, which could be reached in few minutes by walk. I felt really safe at night to walk around in this area, and we reached the Trevi fountain in less than 5 minutes, which was spectacular by night. The hotel is small, but it has some relaxing spot, such as the typical italian internal courtyard. The staff is young but really helpful and kind. I spent a really nice weekend. Suggest to everyone to go to Rome and to Giardino.

Reviews.Title: “We liked this little place!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_Arkansas
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Giardino because of its great location in the heart of historic Rome. It's a walk up one story with no elevator, but that wasn't a big deal.
