You ring their doorbell outside (look for Giardino on the list of building occupants) and they buzz you in. The young staff (they seemed like college students) were friendly, helpful, and they speak great English. The rooms were clean but tiny, the bathrooms were clean though showers were tiny. Towels are the thin linen kind, not the thick ones we're used to in America, but they work fine and new ones were provided daily. The air conditioning worked fine but I suspect it's only available after June 1. In late may you may wish you had a fan with you. Our little group took three rooms and nobody had any complaints. Breakfast was fine and they happily gave one of our group three cappuccinos with every breakfast, no questions asked! They made excellent area restaurant recommendations and were always happy to call us with a taxi when we needed one. TV in the rooms had no English language channels, but they had BBC World News always playing in the lounge. The place was small enough that the staff and even other guests got to know us. That was nice. My room was on the noisy street side, but when I closed and locked the thick, well-built "Swedish-style" windows, 95% of the street noise disappeared. No noise problem at all, really. The place has a pleasant balcony for breakfast overlooking a drab but peaceful inner courtyard. I would indeed use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean space to lay your head with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gasman09
Reviews.Content: Pros: This hotel is a clean place to lay your head when sight seeing in Rome. The location was awesome. You are in walking distance to every major attraction with the exception of the Vatican. The staff spoke English very well and was always willing to give advice, recommendations and directions. Breakfast was basic but great (juice, coffee, tea, bread, cereal and Nutella). Cons: The beds were not very comfortable. However, we stayed in 4 hotels on our trip and that was a con across the board. It can be loud in your room due to the traffic outside and people coming to the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: SteveArizona
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay in Rome. Even though my wife has some problem with walking, she was able to easily manage the steps up to the hotel. And with the central location of the hotel and it being just a few yards from the bus stop, this was the perfect location for our first trip to Rome. Kate and her staff made this a very special stay. Their recommendations for reasonably priced restaurants were outstanding. Kate went out of her way getting several bids for us for car service to Positano, Italy. We really enjoyed our stay in Rome due to the hospitality of the staff and their superb recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: beardown80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple weeks ago. Room was clean and nice, air conditioning worked great which was nice since it was in the 80's that week. This is a perfect location, a short 5-10 minute walk to just about everything. Staff was very helpful, great dinner recommendations. Breakfast was basic and same as all the places we stayed, but good. I would definitley recommend this place to anybody. They gave us a good map of the city also wich was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky break for us.”
Reviews.Author: ellie306
Reviews.Content: We actually had another hotel reserved and arrived there and just didn't feel comfortable or have a good feeling about it. So we got out our Rick Steve's book and searched the surrounding area and found this gem! We were so thankful that they could accomodate us for three nights in this little penzione. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The rooms are tight and so are the bathrooms, but it was clean and well appointed. Breakfast was included, so it was a good value. And it was well located within easy walking distance of the Coloseum and the Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in fabulous and convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: ghuang3
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Giardino with the recommendation from Rick Steves....and we were NOT disappointed! First, the location cannot be beat. The hotel is within easy walking distance from ALL the major sights in Rome with the exception of the Vatican. But that was no problem at all as just around the corner from the hotel is the bus stop! So easy! Once we got off the train in Rome, we found our way very easily to Hotel Giardino with the great directions that were provided. We stayed in two different rooms at this hotel. My sister and her boyfriend stayed in a charming interior room that had a terrace with a table outside! I stayed in a room facing the street....it was very comfortable and the bathroom was HUGE. The shower itself was small, but it is like that most hotels in Italy so it didn't bother us at all. Although our room faced the street, the windows had fabulous double panes and at night we were not disturbed at all. The beds were firm, but comfortable and there was lots of extra pillows and bedding in the closet should you need it. Also, everything was impeccably CLEAN. I am a clean/neat freak and our room met my high standards. Prior to our stay, we had great email communication with the staff and I really want to thank them for answering our many questions. Not only were they prompt and clear in all of their responses (in English), but they were also able to advise us on other portions of our Italian vacation (for example, Katie gave me great advice on purchasing train tickets). Once we got to the hotel, we were able to check in early....before noon! (Thanks Giovanni!) That was a great relief as we had been traveling for quite a while and wanted to freshen up before we hit the sites. The breakfast was so good in the morning. It was served in a delightful little breakfast room with decorative plates on the wall. You could also eat outside on a lovely terrace if you wanted too. Breakfast was yogurt, cereal, some breads, a delicious juice (my boyfriend could not get enough of this) along with a variety of jams and spreads. You also got cappuccino, tea, or hot chocolate. I found the breakfast to be completely sufficient to begin our day. What I enjoyed the most about this hotel was the people and the level of comfort. There is a 24 hour reception so there was always someone to greet you when you came in, and the staff was incredibly friendly and considerate. They were so amiable and we had a lot of great conversations with them. We discussed how awesome Rick Steves was with Katie (he was there when we were there!!!) and we talked about the best place to purchase Nikes online with Giovanni. Hotel Giardino was definitely a great "home away from home" place to stay. This hotel is not a fancy schmancy place if that's what you are looking for. It is small, quaint, with a lot of charm. It is also a great value for your money....and the location is just PERFECT for site-seeing. I highly recommend this hotel and when we come back to Rome, we are definitely staying here again!!!! We had such a great time here. Thank you to everyone at Hotel Giardino! Gina, Marcus, Anna & Royce

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: antonsport
Reviews.Content: We flew into Rome arriving late at night, and had reservations here. The owner is an English lady couldn't have been nicer. The breakfast's were perfect, the location wonderful, and although our room was a bit spartan, that is what we were paying for, and it was clean and very comfortable. Would I stay there again, absoultely.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: dreamtrippers19
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giardino is great. They are very helpful and what a wonderful, centrally located place to stay. After looking at some of the reviews, I have to say that it is along the lines of a Comfort Inn or something similar. If you are looking for luxury, this is not it. This is a comfortable, nice, 3-star hotel- just what you should be expecting for what you pay for. My husband and I could just about walk anywhere (with exception of the Vatican). Katie and her staff were very accommodating. We stayed in two different rooms, one nicer than the other as it had a bigger bathroom. The breakfast consisted of a croissant, a roll, cereal, and yogurt. They will whip you up cappuchino, American coffee, or anything else you want. The beds were comfortable. The area was safe. We would highly recommend this place for anyone. Thanks to Rick Steves- another great recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a great location and the room and staff were great.”
Reviews.Author: Marce915
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, you walk a ton. We walked to almost every major site except the Vatican. This hotel was perfectly located. The staff was very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it loved Rome!”
Reviews.Author: KC_TravelBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Fiance took a trip to Rome for a Romantic getaway over Valentines Day. We chose this hotel as the reviews were so great on here! I am also a Travel Agent and had recommendatiopns from our specialist Tour Operators who sell Italy that this hotel was a great choice. So starting off with all the points: Location: Is great central location. It is 10 minutes to the Collesum, 15 mins to the Trevi fountain and 20 mins to the spanish steps, 30 minutes to the Vatican city. Hotel: Very friendly atmosphere everyone very helpful. A very traditional Bed and Breakfast feel to the place. About 30 rooms Room: The rooms are quite small, clean none the less! We had a double bed. The bathroom is very small you can only fit one person in there at a time. But very clean. Breakfast: The breakfast room as 4 tables in it and also use of the courtyard with tables and chairs in the good weather periods. The breakfast there is cornflakes or museli, a crossiant and roll with a selection of jams,spreads,butter ect....... Tea,coffee,orange juice,hot chocolate. Sights: As it is a great central location then it is easy to walk tho everything. Your legs will be tired by the end of the day though! The entrance tickets are very cheap. 12 euros to get into the Colessum,Phatheon,Acient Ruins. Basilica is free and the sistin chapel is 12 Euros. You can aslo has guided tours which are about 40 Euros per attraction. Trains: We got the train from FCO Airport to the centre which took 30 minutes and cost 11Euros each one way a taxi will cost 30-40 Euros per way. When we got to the centre of Rome we walked to the hotel this took 25minutes. Make sure you get a map before you go! On the way back we got a bus to the train station which you can buy a bus ticket at the hotel which is 1 Euro per person. This took 5 minutes as the bus stop is just across the road. Just get on any that say Staion which is usually the n.o 64 Restraunts: There is so much choice! We asked katie at the hotel to recommend some that were not too expensive she marked them on our map for us. And we also had a wonder during the day we found this great one near the Colessum called Wanted we ate in there both nights Pizzas are great and must have the home made apple pie and home made chocolate mousse delicious!!!! The food here on a average 2 course meal with a drink total 40 Euros. You have to try a ice cream from the ice cream parlours there are 25 different choices of flavours, 5 different types of cones and you only pay 4 Euros for 3 scoops in a cone! They even asl if you want cream on top! The best ice cream we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: goodtripsarebest
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised me with its good value, cleanliness, large bathroom and good service, especially because the hotel is only listed as a two-star hotel. The biggest reason to stay there is because of its excellent location. I organized my review into key points so that you can go directly to the topic that you are most interested in. Price: After the already lower off season rates & Rick Steve's "Rome 2009" guidebook discount, we paid $135/ 90 Euro per night. for a double with a private bathroom, phone in room, exterior window view, and breakfast. Great price compared to comparable rooms. Making Reservations: I read about this place in Rick Steve's "Rome 2009" guidebook, which lists the contact info, but all the current info is listed on the hotel's website, as well. Reservations were easy to make. I just emailed the hotel and secured the reservation that way. You can also contact them via phone. The responses and emails were replied to in a prompt and courteous manner, especially considering that most places, including restaurants and other hotels were not even close to sending same-day responses via email. Everyone spoke English, which made everything much easier. Location: This was the best quality of the hotel. The Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and several other monuments, are within a ten minute walk. There are also lots of cafes, gelaterias, restaurants and tabaccharias on the way to those things, so it's not as though you would have a dead, boring walk to those things. Bus stop is right around the corner. There are several routes that go through that stop, so a Roma Pass would be good if you plan to stay at the hotel at least three days and don't want to walk. Room Details: Spotlessly clean, firm odorless mattress without lumps, tv with Italian channels, and a very large bathroom (considering typical European bathrooms) with a large enough garden shower that it could probably fit a 250 pound woman or a 6.5 foot tall man, phone in room, view of the street with a window that completely cut exterior noise, plenty of towels (thin Euro style linen ones), provided extra pillows upon request, surprsingly quiet room by the main desk, no bathtub. Not sure that this room would be big enough for a family with toddlers/walking-aged children, but it was just the right size for us. Service: Excellent. Surprisingly excellent considering its size and that a lot of two star hotels don't seem to care much about friendly service. The room service cleaned after we left, replaced towels and soap each day. We didn't need too much assistance with arranging rides to the airport, but another couple told us that the employees called the shuttle service for them and arranged it. They told us about great local places to eat that weren't packed with tourists and the food was wonderful. Extras: Not sure if they have wifi. They do not have a public computer or business area, but they let us use their computer to check the status of our flight. Breakfast was good; we were offered a croissant and large roll, coffee/ tea/ espresso, juice, yogurt, cereal and crackers, plus Nutella/ cheese/ pate spread/ etc. No one stole anything or messed with our stuff, but then again I didn't bring any valuables besides the camera. I didn't see a safe in the room or ask about one, There is always someone at the front desk, so that was comforting and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giardino is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LornaBerkeley_CA
Reviews.Content: I love Hotel Giardino. I've stayed here before, and will continue to return whenever I am in Rome because I have been so pleased with this small hotel. I've recommended it to a number of friends and people where I work, who have, in turn, been so pleased that they continue to recommend it to their friends. This reasonably priced hotel is small and charmingly decorated. Breakfast is served either in a small, cosy dining salon, or outside on a small terrace. Hotel Giardino's location is central, conveniently located within walking distance to the Forum and Piazza Navona in one direction, and the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain in the other. The staff is warm, friendly, and extremely helpful. Katie, the proprietress, is a British expat who has lived in Italy for many years. It is she who makes Giardino so very special.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: gladys3152
Reviews.Content: Very friendly boutique type hotel. Rooms are very small but tastefully decorated and perfectly adequate. Bathrooms also very small but everything very clean. Kate the owner is very friendly and has helpful students who are always available to answer questions at front desk. Breakfast lovely with endless capuccinos if you want them and there is always hot water available for afternoon tea on the outside sitting area. This is a great find although probably not ideal for picky Americans. (which is good as we don't need them in this type of hotel anyway). Great location on busroute or easy walking to Trevi fountain and lots of cafes. Would definitely recommend this to all discerning travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome central location!”
Reviews.Author: jessfm107
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, walked to all sites except to Vatican City (#64 or 40 bus to VC just around the corner). David welcomed us and gave us a complimentary beverage ("Coca Fanta"), which was appreciated after arriving from long flights, a train ride, and a walk from the Termini. Stayed in the smaller double (by choice; for the rate), which was manageable for two and didn't seem too much smaller than the other rooms we passed by. Assuming the bathroom is much smaller than others, and it was indeed a VERY tight (but clean) space. The broken soap rack made it a bit harder to maneuver inside the small shower. But these are all little things for this informed traveler. The plusses were big plusses: location (close to sites [~5 min to Trevi, ~10 min to Colosseum] and convenient shops) good rate considering location (thanks to Rick Steves’ book), friendly (and English-speaking) service, breakfast provided (basic but with decent variety), thick newer windows which totally blocked out the loud street noise outside. And did I mention location?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ginarug
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful, accomodating stay at the Hotel Giardino. I highly reccomend staying here. Close to everything! Owner and her sons were extremely hospitable. Food was great. Room was quaint. I had a room with a view! Cafe next door with espresso less than 2 euro's. a wonderful restaurant right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestCannoli_lover
Reviews.Content: This is a small and cozy hotel. Katie, the owner, is very friendly and can answer any questions you have and give you recommendations. The hotel is in a good location and is quiet. Only complaint would be the room (and bathroom) which was very small. The shower may not be good for people who are clausterphobic. I had to put my cosmetics on top of the toilet seat since there was little sink/shelf space. The power briefly went out one night around 11 pm but shortly came back on. Nice breakfast but lack of variety. A good value overall for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Love Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Dmbowman12
Reviews.Content: Rome is simply the most brutal and beautiful place on Earth! I loved the city :) Hotel Giardino had a geat location and was right near all the major sights. I boarded a bus only once to go to vatican City, otherwise was able to walk to almost every destination! The staff was great, rooms clean, and the place safe and secure! I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ouden_oida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located, and it's really really sweet. Just be careful, the "small double room" you can see in their website is indeed very small! We had to book that one since it was the only one available, and there was hardly enough space for us to move around the room (not to mention the bathroom!) However it was very centrally located, you could walk to most of the main monuments, and very clean and cute. There was also a nice terrace that we couldn't use, since it was winter when we visited, but I believe will be very nice for breaksfast in summer. You could also have breakfast in the room, which was great. All in all a very pleasant stay in Rome, though if I came back I believe I would ask for a bigger room...

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Oasis central to most historic sites”
Reviews.Author: finicky1
Reviews.Content: Wow, I can't believe it's taken so long to post this stay. Back then, I was a newbie reviewer and posted one on Rick Steve's Graffiti Wall. But I thought it's about time more people appreciate this place if it's not overbooked already. We stayed at this pensione for 7 nights in February 2005 and got a great rate of US$80-something/night. What a bargain for Rome, even in the off season. This is one lodging which I happily found to look better in person than in pictures...how often does that happen? Almost never! Although this room -206-was small (there is an amoire and a large, comfy oversized loungy chair- wonderfully relaxing after a day of roaming around), it has a balcony and was very rustically charming with squeaky clean hardwood floors. The reception area is modest and doesn't boast much upon entry, but the rooms are more warm and welcoming. The views to the church across the street, and from the balcony, down either side of the street remind you that you're in ROME. There is quite a bit of traffic along this street but you would never know it once you close the triple? :) glazed window. All the noise fades away and your room becomes this oasis. Aaaahh....The church bells across the street are at the perfect volume with windows closed, sounding more like they are ringing from a few streets away. In fact, it was quiet enough for a mid-day nap every day ;)...gotta keep up with those Roman night-owls. The beds and linens are are very comfortable. At the time we stayed, it seemed like they'd been replaced not too long ago as they were more comfy than the pictures looked. So this place does a good job of replacing older linens I think. But as with other hotels in Italy, they had very spartan waffle textured towels which are comparable to dishtowels found at chain kitchen stores which I won't name as I don't believe in free advertising for them; at least they were not the linen napkin kind that hotels had in Venice that didn't soak up anything. An Old World thing perhaps? The bathroom was very clean albeit on the smaller side. Heavier than average people would have not been comfortable in the shower. Maybe other rooms have bigger showers than the corner ones? The housekeeping person works so hard but was beyond appreciative when we left her a 10Euro tip for our entire stay. That doesn't break down to much per person per day. In the US, if they don't feel you've tipped them enough, they clean out the mini-bar and it gets charged to your room. Incredulous. The breakfast was good but not gourmet by any means. Having Tang for breakfast was something I hadn't experienced since I was a child in the 70s. A little nostalgia is good for the soul I guess :). It was very cold when we were there and the one day they had time to warm our baguette in the oven made the breakfast SO much better than other days when they didn't as the baguette was hard. But since the dining room was overseen mostly by 1 person, we didn't want to over-burden her. But coffeee was made to order and warmed us up nicely to brave the chill outside. On warmer days, you can choose to have breakfast on the quaint terrace in the back. Very tranquil. The hotel is a stone's throw away from Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon, most of the Piazzas, and all the eateries and gelaterias you could possibly want. We walked every where. But the older travelers may prefer transport to say, the Vatican or the Colosseum. Be sure to head to the Forum and Colosseum early - before the tour buses encroach upon the area. If these two places are not opened yet, head up/across the street to Palatine Hill first to make use of time. It's so peaceful to ponder ancient Rome when you have the place almost to yourselves. And when the buses come, you can escape to a nice cafe near the Trajan Market and watch the local cats. This pensione is well run by Katie, a Brit ex-pat who's spent more than 1/2 her life in Italy, so she practically Italian as she is married to one. Katie is a wealth of knowledge, and will graciously help you plan your day. When we go back to Italy, we will definitely stop here to recover from jetlag en route to Naples/the islands even though we've gotten more picky with accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Rome experience”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_couple08
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was in a great location in Rome, 12 Euro from train station and near major tourist sites. Staff very helpful with excellent english. The air conditioned room was large by European standards. Only drawback was 30 steps to the first floor premisis. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Roman Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wolch
Reviews.Content: Found through Rick Steves. Got breakfast included, which we hadn't anticipated. Double-paned windows effective in blocking out most street noise, but we stayed near the main desk and heard just about everything there. Still, the hotel room, both in size and decor, was outstanding. Kate (the owner) was gracious and helpful -- felt like a community there. Great location -- we walked all the way to the Vatican and Spanish Steps without problem, and it's terrifically close to Trevi and Piazza Venezia, as well as most of the Roman ruins.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: sonnyboy59
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at hotel giardino for the very convenient location and the moderate rates. We knew that we were going to a small hotel also because they explained this before we reserved. We had a wonderful time and found the staff very kind and helpful. We have already booked for our return trip later in the year with our children

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well situated”
Reviews.Author: sacramentowanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Giardino April 23-26. We found this property well situated (walked from Termini and walked everywhere else), clean, with friendly helpful staff (esp. Kate) The breakfast consists of juice, coffee, tea, cappuccino, rolls, cereal. It's on the 1st. floor (which is our 2nd. floor) so you must be able to walk up stairs and carry your luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: WCD4983
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop in our 2 week Italy vacation and our 7th hotel. It was also our cheapest at 110 Euros a night. As for the positives, the price is great and the staff were all very friendly. When we contacted the hotel for booking, they told us that there only available room was their smallest (which is why the price was so low). So, I am not going to complain about the room size as I knew it would be small. The negatives that I am going to mention are the cleanliness, general state of repair, breakfast, noise, and location. The cleanliness wasn't terrible. I wouldn't call the room dirty, but I definitely wouldn't call it clean. Our shower had obvious mold and leaked terribly (hence why they had a mold problem). If the windows were shut all day, the room definitely had a mold/mildew smell. I think the room was cleaned adequately day to day, but I don't think it had a real intensive scrubbing in a long time. The general state of repair was actually probably my biggest problem with our room. Again, the shower was basically falling apart. It was the tiny stall shower that we had all over Italy, but the plastic shelf was completely broken and just dangling there leaving no where to place for your shampoo or soap which wouldn't be a problem if the stall wasn't a telephone booth! My husband I are not big people at all, but we found it very uncomfortable and awkward to try to get to our toiletries and we won't even mention me attempting to shave my legs! Also, in the shower, the shower head was one of the detachable ones which had obviously broken at some point and had been replaced. However, they hadn't replaced the mounted piece which holds it up so it sort of precariously rested on the mount in one position and on multiple occasions fell. Sometimes it just sprayed the ceiling, but other times it landed on our heads! I guess the point of this description is that I felt like they didn't care about their guests' comfort. If they had to shower in that shower, they certainly would have made the necessary repairs, but I felt like since I was in the little room (the budget room), my comfort wasn't a priority. The whole shower experience really soured my mood on this hotel. The breakfast was fine, it just wasn't what we had at other our other 6 hotels and the room was tiny and made conversation awkward. Again, it was adequate just not up to par with some of our other hotels (and we were on a budget ... we spent no more than 150 Euros on a room). The noise was only a problem at night. Italy in May = no A/C so you need to open the window, but when your room overlooks a busy street it isn't really practical to sleep with your window open. And finally, the location which again wasn't terrible, but wasn't great. It was very close to a lot of sites which were great, but it wasn't near any good restaraunts or the metro. I think I would have preferred to be a little closer to one of the major sites which would have had more access to shopping, dining, and transportation. Overall, as my title states, this hotel was OK. I wouldn't say it was terrible, and I wouldn't caution against staying here categorically. I would simply recommend doing your research and price comparisons before settling on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Hotel Giardino”
Reviews.Author: ShannonK1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Giardino in October 2007 (sorry for the belated review) and had a wonderful experience. I was traveling alone on that trip - I'm female and often mistaken for a graduate student - so I was concerned about safety. The hotel is located just down the street from the Quirinale (presidential palace) and, as the staff pointed out, I was staying on one of the safest streets in Rome due to heightened security in the area. I felt completely secure walking to and from the hotel at night. The staff, especially Katie, were outstanding and I highly recommend this hotel. The price (and the breakfast) were great, and my room was spotless and very quiet. As I was traveling alone, the staff was very helpful with suggestions and keeping track of my whereabouts - I caused them quite a bit of concern when I stayed out very late one night, and I appreciated that they cared about my safety.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: plumeria54
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel located within relatively easy walking of most everything. Room was small but very clean and quiet; good breakfast each morning; staff was very helpful and friendly. It was nice being able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and still be able to go back to the hotel for a sweater when it got cold at night. Especially considering the price, it was a great place to stay for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: carkrisy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel nice and basic. Clean room and bathroom. The Bathroom was very small and as was the room. Breakfast was include and got you off to a good start. This hotel is in a great location for touring Rome. I think if you are looking for a nice clean place in a good location this will be good for you. Not a lot of extra amenities but, was not expecting them. I did not get to meet Katie she must of not been there when I was. The day staff was helpful and pleasant. I foundd the guy who worked in the evening to be short and a touch rude. You will have stairs to climb to your room if that is a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place for location and price!”
Reviews.Author: AussieBecs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Giardino in early December and had a fabulous time. We had a very large room, with our own patio overlooking the courtyard. Bedroom had a queen bed, TV, shower, toilet and bidet. No bath or fridge. Breakfasts were very nice - croissant, roll, jams, yoghurt, coffee, tea, juice, etc. The thing about this hotel is that the location cannot be beaten. You are literally in the heart of it all - a short walk to the Forum and Colosseum, also 5 minutes to the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. It really is amazing how quick the walking distances are! Took the bus (10 minutes) to Vatican City - you can buy bus tickets directly from Katie at reception. Katie is lovely and very helpful. Would highly recommend this to those wanting a nice, clean, central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PrairieGal99
Reviews.Content: Our favorite thing about this hotel was the location! Just two blocks up from the Trevi Fountain! And we were walking location to everything else and the bus stop is just around the corner. The room was on the small side (the bathroom even smaller!) but clean and well-kept and we didnt' spend much time in there during our 3 days anyhow. Our room looked onto the courtyard at the back so we could hear the AC fan that's back there, but we're light sleepers so others would probably be fine. The usual Italian hotel breakfast was included - best part is the coffee! Otherwise, the usual "Tang" drink, bread roll and brioche (Italian-style croissant). The staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions (thanks to Thomas for his help!). Good value for money here. Would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSpartans
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location. The quad room was small but very clean (very small shower). Very close to Forum area and Trevi Fountain and many major sites. Staff was extremely helpful, everyone speaks English. Despite being a busy street, the new windows blocked out all the noise, it was very quiet. Would strongly recommend this hotel and would stay here again. Breakfast included- carbs and coffee. High kudos to the staff for giving us a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sarge56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in October and in that short time, still felt very welcome and got to know Serge, Thomas and Katie while there. You can't beat the location, as others have stated. It is as central Rome as you can get. Staff very friendly and helpful, recommending restaurants, ATM machines, etc. Room was clean with large wardrobe and window onto courtyard. It was cold when we were there, but told heat cannot be turned on until Nov 4th. Not a problem for me, I like to sleep in the cold, but DD was a little chilly. Price was right at 150E per night. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet stay in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MofromMass
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime location. The rates are very reasonable. The staff is friendly and the rooms are comfortable. We stayed in a room away from the street and we did not hear any noise all night. That's a remarkable thing, considering what a noisy city Rome is! The best part was sharing breakfast with the staff every morning. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Giardino”
Reviews.Author: traveler10025
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed at the Hotel Giardino for almost a week in October and had a wonderful time. The hotel is in a great location, serves a wonderful cappuccino in the morning and the owner, Kate, and staff couldn't be nicer or more helpful. Two suggestions when booking this hotel: request a room on the outside (two even have small balconies) and make sure that you learn how to use the air conditioner if the weather is warm since the street is noisy and keeping the window open all night is not an option for a restful sleep. All in all, a great stay and definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “A very personal stay - Kate makes it special”
Reviews.Author: artphotogirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last three days of our 20th wedding anniversary trip at the Hotel Giardino. It was a perfect end to a wonderful vacation. The Hotel Giardino is small in size but big on personality. Kate, the owner, was like our best friend. She was always smiling (not sure how she was so happy all the time, but she was). We were greated each day by Kate and she took our coffee/tea order and made sure that we had everything we needed. The first morning I asked her if they had herbal tea. She had some but felt that it might not be totally fresh. The next day, she brought me some fresh herbal tea - she had gone out and bought some tea especially for me. How thoughtful!! She also set up our taxi departure for the day we had to leave along with giving us great tips on how to get around Rome. We had the Roma Pass and were able to use the bus / metro (I highly recommend that). Our room had the only private outside terrace, the other terrace was used by ALL the guests. We loved sitting outside (on our terrace) eating lunch, having an afternoon gelato or enjoying a glass of wine before running off to see more of Rome. The room itself was small, but cozy. Even so, we would definitely stay with Kate and her staff again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mnorman13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Giardino August 22-28, 2007. We arrived tired and excited after a delayed flight. We were greeted warmly and given room 20, directly across from the reception desk. This worried me, as I have read other reviewers comments about it being loud. But we decided to brave it and it wasn't so bad. My husband said he heard the night deskman pacing once and we did hear the clanking of dishes in the morning when it was time to get up. Mostly we were so exhausted that we heard nothing until we awoke each morning. We did hear conversation and the TV when we can back for an afternoon nap, but that was easily drowned out by our own TV. Our room was good size with a queen bed, chair, console table, small suspended TV, wardrobe and private bathroom. There was plenty of room for us to walk around, even with our suitcases on the floor. The air conditioner worked great! The room wasn't too stuffy without it as we turned the it off each day when we left and back on upon our return at night. The bathroom was long and narrow with a stand-up shower only. The water pressure was in the low to medium range. There was only one occassion when it wasn't very warm and probably a peak shower time. The only complaint would be that the water changed temperature during the shower. It would go colder, then the set temp, then hotter...this happend a few times during a 15 min shower. It was small in size, I touched a wall if I bent down to get something. This made it challenging to shave my legs, but could do so balancing on the other. You could probably also do it by sitting on the closed toilet seat and stick your leg in the shower. The towels were like a bed sheet, very thin but very absorbant. Bring your own if you have to have plush towels. There is also a hair dryer, but it is not very powerful...would take a long time for someone with long or thicker hair to get dry. A tip: don't flush the toilet when someone else is in the shower, it makes it VERY hot! I cannot rave enough about the location of the hotel. The street is a connector between Via Nazionale and Via Quirinale. We were just down the street from the Piazza Quirinale, 5 min walk to the Trevi fountain and Trajan's column, 10 min walk to Victor Emmanuel Monument, 15 min walk to Colesseum and 20 min walk to Termini. The staff was also wonderful. They called us a cab when we were running late to the Borghese, gave us croissants in the morning to take away when we didn't have time to sit down, and phoned when our car had arrived to take us to the airport at 5:20am. The hotel and our room were very clean. It is located in an apartment building where you needed to be buzzed in to come upstairs (two flights). There are a couple of nice restaurants very close by and an ATM machine up the street. Breakfast is very simple; a croissant and roll with orange juice and your choice or cappuccino, espresso, or hot chocolate. We had a great experience and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: luvnormandy
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 rooms & everyone was most impressed with the location. Compared to other European cities, Rome's sights are located within a small radius, giving you the chance to walk almost anywhere. Hotel Giardino is ideally located for walking; we walked everywhere except to the Vatican. But a taxi stand is just a short walk from the hotel, & cabs are regulated in Rome, so we never paid more than 5 Euros to go anywhere with 4 people in the car. The rooms are small but efficient, it's very quiet, & the AC works great. Breakfast was good, served in a small breakfast room by reception. Katie in the morning & Tom, her son, in the evenings were a delight. Both have a wonderful sense of humor. Ask Tom anything, & you'll get an honest answer - very helpful to tourists - gave us recommendations on restaurants. The hotel is on the second floor, but when we arrived, Tom came down to help us with all the luggage. Since the hotel met all our needs, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best, But not the Worst!”
Reviews.Author: jakuehl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May. Our room was tiny and bathroom, though small, was adequate. As one post mentioned, it did have a urine smell. The breakfast was very good, and Kate was helpful and pleasant. Not sure about Sergio. He seemed moody to me, but maybe I'm just a sensitive American. Great location, but if I were in Rome again, I think I would choose another hotel. Of our 24 day vacation, this was our most expensive room and we stayed in many tourist spots where the prices tend to be a little higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Indecisive2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in this hotel from the 25th May. Our room was very basic and right by the reception but this was not a problem . bathroom was very small but apart from that I have no complaints. To be fair when I booked it Kate did inform me it was there last room available so it was my decision to go with it . The location could not be better. Everything is within walking distance except the Vatican and you can get a bus literally outside the door straight there. We mainly dealt with Sergio and I think the owners son who were both very friendly and very helpful. Sergio is great fun and we had a good laugh with him. We met Katie the morning we checked out and she was very kind and helpful. If you need a centraly located hotel at a really good price then look no further. I have no hesitation in saying book this hotel if you can. Enjoy Rome - its a wonderful city .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Westport
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights in May. The location is perfect for walking around Rome and we felt very safe at this hotel and the area. We were minutes away from the Trevi so we would walk over every evening! Our room was very small and the bathroom was amusing. We are small people and we had great trouble in the shower so I'm not sure what anyone over 115 pounds would do in that shower. There was also a urine smell in the bathroom but when I complained about it, Sergio said it was the smell of the disinfectant. I have my doubts because a friend smelled it also and her bathroom did not have the same smell. The staff in general are very nice and helpful especially Katie. She was delightful! So, despite the smelly, small bathroom we thought this hotel was fine for 130 Euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Bolin78
Reviews.Content: After a long flight....we were happy to get to the Hotel Giardino. Yes, as one individual posted earlier, you do indeed have to walk up a few stairs to get to the hotel, but unless you have a handicap of sorts it should be no big issue. Our room was bigger then expected, and we had a charming little patio connected to it where we enjoyed breakfast each morning. Though very close to the city center, you really don't notice the noise while in your room! It seriously was a 15-20 minute walk to most sites in Roma, except the Vatican but a short bus ride takes you straight there. (Bus stop around the corner from the hotel). Breakfast was good, and we enjoyed it....only in Rome can one eat Nutella for breakfast and feel no guilt. *winks* We greatly enjoyed our stay, was glad it was so centrally located...and Katie and Sergio couldn't have been nicer. They really went out of their way to assist you. The rooms are very clean and tidy.....water pressure great.....no issues with hot water....was very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: traveler5550
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with a warm, welcoming, and helpful staff. Central location was great. Small and cozy, clean and comfortable. Perfect for exploring Rome on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyslap
Reviews.Content: Delighted with the location of this hotel. Within short walking distance of Trevi Fountain and other 'must see' places. The owner and staff (English speaking) were very helpful with general advice and suggestions for restaurants, travel etc. Excellent value for money considering the location and would especially recommend this hotel for a short break. We shall be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Best in its class”
Reviews.Author: 2weeksis2little
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Giardino. My husband and I had originally booked a much more expensive hotel, but decided to stay here instead. We were glad we did! Katie and the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful for the duration of our stay. She was happy to book a museum time, arrange a shuttle to the airport and sell us bus tickets when we needed them. It was central to most everything we wanted to see, but picking up a taxi or bus was a snap. Our room was great too. The bed was comfortable and although it faced a busy street, the double-paned windows did their job and we slept soundly. Our bathroom was quite large, and although the shower was small, it was clean and worked great. You could get more amenities at a larger or more expensive hotel, but you would have to spend a lot more money to get to a higher category. Unless you want to spend well over 200 euro a night, this is a great pick and definitely exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “OUR ROOM was tiny, bathroom bothered us...”
Reviews.Author: rykzk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Giardino in October, 2005. The room was pretty, but quite small, so we could not pass between the bed and the wall at the same time. Headboard, bedside lamp, and drawers were dusty. I tried to wipe, but I could not remove the caked dust. This room had not been used for a long time? But the floor and the bed sheets were clean. Towels were very thin. Those were a kind of tablecloth!? I've never seen like that. They were wet soon after using, of course. The shower space was sooooo TINY that I had to keep tightly my arms on my side all the time I was washing my hair. And after taking a shower, the floor in the bathroom flooded. We asked to change the room to the owner, but not available, but...she gave us a discount. Maybe...the other rooms are larger and nicer...maybe...I think so. We asked her, the owner the day before checking out whether we could pay with the credit card. She said "No". So we went to a bank where was located far from the hotel to prepare cash, but they had a credit card machine...WHAT? We were shocked. The location was good, we could go many places in Rome. Staffs were friendly, bread as breakfast was fresh and tasty. I recommend you staying one of the OTHER rooms in this hotel, but I'm not sure the others are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Warm staff, terrific location, A/C!”
Reviews.Author: MandDR5657
Reviews.Content: After a long and miserable overnight train ride and having the bus driver take off with the kids and our bags but without the adults, at an ungodly early morning hour, AND with temperatures hovering around 100, Kate (Katie?) at Hotel Giardino offered us a warm and friendly welcome. We put down our bags and had a quiet breakfast (for which we were never charged since our check in wasn't until later that day). Kate and Sergio were a delight, providing restaurant and sight recommendations, directions, and advice on the use of somewhat complex bus rituals. Sergio provided splendid comic relief. He's a card! The location couldn't be beat. Our exterior room was quiet with the window closed. There is internet access three shops down and it is readily available and inexpensive. Our room was clean, the room and bathroom large by most European standards in our experience. Our A/C worked fabulously and was a life saver during this summer's heat wave. Our kid's (17, 15, 10) room was next door. This was a Rick Steves recommendation and it was right on. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will likely return again on our next visit to Bella Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: DRPromiseMH
Reviews.Content: What can we say... We arrived after an all night train from Nice, France that was hot (40Cent) and noisy -- we never slept and were bedraggled. We made our bus connection and walked from the bus-stop to Hotel Giardino with all our bags and backbacks . From the moment we entered Hotel Giardino we were treated like family. Even though we were early for check-in, Kate offered us a bathroom to wash up a bit and breakfast. We then were offered a place to set our bags so we could go off on foot to see the Colosseum and Katie provided us with a map. Katie was always kind and helpful and Sergio was, hands down, the funniest and engaging front desk assistant we came across in our 3 week vacation through France and Italy. The hotel has all the basics including a/c. The continental breakfast was not the biggest in selection (and the server did not appear to enjoy her job at all) but Katie and Sergio made Hotel Giardino! After all, unless you are going for 5 star-ish hotels, isn't it really all about the people you meet assuming all else is clean and in order? They are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkies500
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on our three week trip through Rome, and the quality and location of the hotel made for a nice finish. The hotel location is quite convenient to all the major sites in Rome, and we greatly enjoyed being able to come back to the room for a short mid-day rest (siesta!). It was an easy walk to nearly everywhere, and there are well-traveled bus stops less than a block away on Via Nazionale for more distant stops (e.g., catacombs). Despite it's nearness to the sites, it was a quiet location and we never heard traffic noise from our interior room. The only surprise when we first arrived was that the hotel isn't on the ground floor - you have to be buzzed into the front door shared with other residents. It felt like a very safe neighborhood, with a strong police presence due to the nearby presidential palace (Quirinale). Like most European city hotel rooms, the room was compact but comfortable. Furnishings were in good shape and up-to-date. The included air conditioning worked quite well at all hours. The included continental breakfast was quite sufficient, and it was the only hotel on our trip that made hot chocolate available - a nice change from the ever-present tea and coffee. Staff was very helpful and most understood and spoke English quite well. There wasn't any internet access in the hotel, but it was available for a very good price just three doors down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Giardino”
Reviews.Author: cruginis
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 wonderful days in Rome at the Hotel Giardino and really enjoyed the helpfulness of Sergio and Katie! We arrived a day early and even though there was not room available at Hotel Giardino, Sergio spent considerable effort finding us a one night stay at a hotel nearby. He also gave us a great last minute tip on how to get into the Borghesi Gallery without advance reservations. The rooms are spacious, charming and very, very clean and the owner Katie, just couldn't be nicer!!! The breakfast is very adequate and served in a charming room or outside on the balcony. Hotel Giardino is a very good value and we would definately stay there again! Al & Cindy from Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: robynDallas
Reviews.Content: My husband ,daughter and myself stayed here first week of June. The location is great. Really able to walk to most sights. The breakfast gets a little old--croissant and hard roll everyday. Kate, the owner was extremely pleasant. The stay would have been alot more pleasant had Sergio been the least bit friendly. We would walk right by him every morning or afternoon and he wouldn't even look up. A little too arrogant for us. Luckily our accomodations in Florence and Siena far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Area_Local
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from an Easter break in Rome staying 3 nights at the Giardino. We had the small double room on the street side. This room was very small and the shower could only be entered sideways. The hotel location is excellent and the rate is very reasonable for Rome. Walls are very thin, could here the next room removing toilet paper from the holder. Ear plugs a must. If I return to Rome I would pay more and stay in a 3 star. This is still good value for a 2 star in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “So-so Room in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sam364
Reviews.Content: I will preface this by saying that my husband and I usually stay in at least 3-star hotels or higher. This hotel is a 2-star by their own admission, and we kept our expectations in check as a result. We stayed at the hotel for 5 days and had the room at the end of the hall, facing the courtyard. We were grateful for this, considering that I knew the street rooms would be noisy, and the courtyard itself tended to be somewhat noisy at times. The room was a little small, as we expected, as was the bathroom, which was the size of a closet, but both were clean, if not a bit worn (scuff marks on the walls). The shower fixtures were updated, though, and warm water was mostly available when we wanted it. We would have had an issue with the room if 1) the walls were so thin that my husband and I had to whisper if we wanted to speak privately since we could hear conversations down the hall and on the other side of our wall, 2) a funky smell had not permeated the air when the housekeeper put foot rugs into our room on the second day, and 3) we had amenities that I had taken for granted, such as a second trash can and tissues. On the positive side, the staff was very nice; the breakfast, as described by other reviewers, was more than efficient for us; and the location was fantastic. Trajan's Market and the Quirinale are within view, the Trevi Fountain is a 5-minute walk away, and the Colosseum and Roman Forum are a 10-minute walk away. The bus stop is literally around the corner on Via Nazionale, and Bus #64 will take you to the Vatican. Also, a small internet cafe is two or three doors down. All in all, the hotel suited our needs, but we would pay more for a place with the "comfort" and amenities that we're used to the next time we're in Rome.
